raspilot.commands package¶

Submodules¶

raspilot.commands.base_command_handler module¶

exception raspilot.commands.base_command_handler.ActionExecutionError(exception)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Exception is thrown if an error during action execution occurs.

exception¶
class raspilot.commands.base_command_handler.BaseCommandHandler(name)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class used in CommandsExecutor. Wraps command name and desired action.

execute_action(data, command_id, request, response)[source]¶

Runs the action. If any error is thrown, it is caught and an ActionExecution error is thrown instead. :param data: additional data for the command :param command_id: id of the command :param request: request flag :param response: response object which contains additional information about the request execution, can be None :return: returns an ActionResult object

name¶
raspilot.commands.base_command_handler.nop(data, request)[source]¶

raspilot.commands.command module¶

class raspilot.commands.command.Command(name, data, request, response)[source]¶

Bases: object

General command used in control the Raspilot

data¶
classmethod from_json(data)[source]¶

Constructs new command from provided dict. :param data: dict to load data from :return: returns newly created command

name¶
request¶
response¶
serialize()[source]¶

Serializes the command as a dict. :return: returns serialized command

raspilot.commands.commands_executor module¶

exception raspilot.commands.commands_executor.CommandExecutionError(error)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown when an Exception is risen during command execution.

error¶
class raspilot.commands.commands_executor.CommandsExecutor[source]¶

Bases: object

Executes commands if they have a callable associated with their name.

add_command_handler(command_handler)[source]¶

Adds new command handler. Should be a subclass of the BaseCommandHandler :param command_handler: new command handler :return:

execute_command(command_name, data, command_id, request, response)[source]¶

If command is bound, executes the action. :param command_name: name of the command which should be executed :param data: additional data for the command :param command_id: id of the command :param request: flag whether the command is a request which should be responded to :param response: response object which contains additional information about the request execution, can be None :return: returns nothing :raises: raspilot.commands.base_command_handler.ActionExecutionError if any error occurs during the action execution

messages_thread¶
notify_command_failed(command_name, data, command_id, response)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • command_name – name of the command which execution fails
  • data – data provided for the command, might be None
  • command_id – id of the command
  • response – response object which contains additional information about the request execution, might be None
remove_command_handler(command_name)[source]¶

Removes the command handler. If command handler has not been added previously, nothing is changed. :param command_name: name of the command, which handler will be removed :return: returns command handler or None, if command is not bound

running¶
send_message(command_name, data, request, response)[source]¶

Constructs general message object from provided data and adds it to the send queue. :param command_name: name of the command which should be sent :param data: data for the command, might be None :param request: flag, whether the command is a request :param response: response object, contains additional information about the request execution, might be None :return: returns True if message was sent, False otherwise

stop()[source]¶
class raspilot.commands.commands_executor.MessageTransmitter[source]¶

Bases: object

raspilot.commands.response module¶

class raspilot.commands.response.CommandResponse(request_id, success, data=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Response object. Sent in Android and websocket commands. Used when responding to commands which has requests flag set.

classmethod from_json(json_data)[source]¶

Deserializes the CommandResponse from the provided json :param json_data: json object to load from :return: returns deserialized CommandResponse

serialize()[source]¶

Serializes the object as a JSON object. :return:
